class mav_sim.chap8.observer.AlphaFilter(alpha: float = 0.5, y0: float = 0.0)¶

Bases: object

alpha filter implements a simple low pass filter y[k] = alpha * y[k-1] + (1-alpha) * u[k]

update(u: float) → float¶

Update teh filter

Parameters:

u – latest input

Returns:

filtered value

Return type:

y

class mav_sim.chap8.observer.EkfAttitude¶

Bases: object

Implement continous-discrete EKF to estimate roll and pitch angles

i.e., maintains an estimate for xhat = [phi, theta]

f(x: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], measurement: AttitudeMeasurement, state: AttitudeState) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

system dynamics for propagation model: xdot = f(x, u)

Parameters:

  • x – vector with [phi, theta]

  • measurement – latest attitude sensor data

  • state – latest state (for biases)

Returns:

Dynamics for state [phi, theta]

Return type:

f_

h(x: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], measurement: AttitudeMeasurement, state: AttitudeState) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

measurement model y

Parameters:

  • x – vector with [phi, theta]

  • measurement – latest attitude sensor data

  • state – latest state (for biases)

Returns:

Measurements vector [x-accel, y-accel, z-accel]

Return type:

h_

class mav_sim.chap8.observer.EkfPosition¶

Bases: object

implement continous-discrete EKF to estimate pn, pe, Vg, chi, wn, we, psi

f(x: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], measurement: PositionMeasurement, state: PositionState) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

system dynamics for propagation model: xdot = f(x, u)

Parameters:

  • x – vector with [_, _, Vg, chi, wn, we, psi]

  • measurement – latest attitude sensor data

  • state – latest state

Outputs:

f_: Dynamics for state [pn, pe, Vg, chi, wn, we, psi]

  • state – latest state

h_: Measurement [pn, pe, Vg, chi]

mav_sim.chap8.observer.jacobian(fun: Callable[[ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], AttitudeMeasurement, AttitudeState], ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]] | Callable[[ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], PositionMeasurement, PositionState], ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]], x: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], measurement: AttitudeMeasurement | PositionMeasurement, state: AttitudeState | PositionState) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

compute jacobian of fun with respect to x

Parameters:

  • fun – function about which jacobian is being taken

  • x – state about which to compute jacobian

  • measurement – current sensor measurements

  • state – current state values

Returns:

jacobian of “fun” with respect to the state

Return type:

J
